Coordinator

Class Processor

  • java.lang.Object
    • Coordinator.Processor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CentralProcessor, PreProcessor, Solver

    public abstract class Processor
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the superclass for PreProcessor, CentralProcessor and all Solver classes.
    It provides the following common functionalities:
    - data which is common to all processors
    - monitors for the central data
    - tasks for simplifying clauses
    - the simplifications on new clauses.

    The system distinguishes the core data structures and the supplementary data structures.
    The core data structures are: model (unit clauses), implicationDAG (binary clauses) and clauses (longer clauses)
    Among the supplementary data structures are the equivalence classes and the disjointness classes. They are constructed by the PreProcessor and maintained by the CentralProcessor.

    An important component is the taskQueue. It keeps tasks in a listPosition list.
    Tasks are:
    - processing unit clauses
    - processing binary clauses
    - simplifying longer clauses (subsumption and replacement resolution)
    - processing pure literals
    - reporting results (satisfiability, unsatisfiablity, errors)

    Created by ohlbach on 10.10.2018.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Processor

        public Processor(ProblemSupervisor supervisor,
                 GlobalParameters globalParameters,
                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> applicationParameters,
                 BasicClauseList basicClauseList)
        constructs a processor and initializes the common fields
        Parameters:
        supervisor - which manages the problem
        globalParameters - for overall management
        applicationParameters - either the problemParameters or the solverParameters
        basicClauseList - the input clauses (n particular for checking a candidate model)

    • Method Detail

      • addMonitors

        protected void addMonitors(java.lang.String info)
        This method adds the monitors to the core data structures (clauses,implicationDAG, disjointness classes (if there are some) and equivalence classes (if there are some).
        Parameters:
        info - for later printout.

      • removeMonitors

        protected void removeMonitors()
        This method removes the monitors from the core data structures.
        It needs to be called unless the core data structures become garbage anyway.

      • addTask

        public void addTask(Task task)
        adds a task to the task queue. It notifies a getTask-method in the central processor, which might be waiting for new tasks
        Parameters:
        task - the task to be added

      • makeShortenedClauseTask

        protected Task makeShortenedClauseTask(Clause clause,
                                       Processor processor)
        generates a task according to the clause's length (empty clauses, unit clauses, binary clauses and longer ones).
        Parameters:
        clause - a clause (maybe empty)
        processor - which has to process the task.
        Returns:
        the corresponding task to be added to the task queue

      • processTasks

        public Result processTasks()
        processes all task until a result is obtained or the queue becomes empty
        Returns:
        Un/Satisfiable if there was a result, otherwise null.

      • processOneLiteralClause

        public Result processOneLiteralClause(int literal)
        computes the consequences of a new unit clause in the clauses and the implicationDAG.
        Equivalence classes need not be changed because it is assumed that all their literals
        are already replaced by their representatives
        Disjointness classes need not be changed because the information is also in the implicationDAG
        Parameters:
        literal - a newly derived unit clause.
        Returns:
        Unsatisfiable if a contradiction has been discovered, otherwise null

      • trueLiteralInQueue

        private Result trueLiteralInQueue(int literal)
        This method traverses the task queue to implement the consequences of a true literal on the remaining tasks
        Parameters:
        literal - a true literal
        Returns:
        Unsatisfiable or null

      • processTwoLiteralClause

        public Result processTwoLiteralClause(int literal1,
                                      int literal2)
        simplifies all clauses with the new two-literal clause and inserts it into the implicationDAG
        This may cause new unit clauses, binary clauses and other shortened causes to be generated and put into the task queue.
        Parameters:
        literal1 - a literal
        literal2 - a literal
        Returns:
        null

      • processLongerClause

        public Result processLongerClause(Clause clause)
        performs simplifications with new or shortened clauses:
        - all subsumed clauses are removed
        - all replacement resolutions (with the implicationDAG) are performed.
        This may generate further tasks in the task queue.
        Parameters:
        clause - a new or simplified clause.
        Returns:
        null

      • processEquivalence

        public Result processEquivalence(int[] equivalents)
        The method replaces all members of the equivalence class by their representative. If equivalences is defined then the new equivalence class is first merged with the older ones.
        Parameters:
        equivalents - an equivalence class [representative, literal_1,...]
        Returns:
        null

      • processPurity

        public Result processPurity(int literal)
        makes pure literals true and removes them from the clauses and the implicationDAG.
        A literal which seemed to be pure may in fact not be pure if an equivalence has been detected and removed from the implicationDAG, but is still in the taskQueue This has to be checked anew.
        Parameters:
        literal - a pure literal
        Returns:
        null or Satisfiable

      • processLiteralRemoval

        public Result processLiteralRemoval(java.lang.String clauseId,
                                    int literal)
        This method removes a literal from a clause if one of the solvers has discovered that the literal can be removed
        Parameters:
        clauseId - if the clause containing the literal
        literal - the literal to be removed
        Returns:
        null
